Name: Cyber
Short Description: A purple version of Stitch with the same abilities, but he is turning into a black, cyborg experiment, part machine part alien. His alien form resembles a cross between some sort of lizard, and koala (and robot) with bat-like face. He has two cyborg arms, three spider-like legs, and half-helmet (right half of his face is metal) with big black cyclopic-like right eye from some unknown incident. His cyborg arms serve many purposes such as cybernatic wiry rope, laser guns, forked harpoon, and welding tool, and his cyborg eye has zoom functions and improves his aim. He is an evil experiment that is a cyborg version of Stitch. He then attempts to put an early ending to their emerging rivalry by proceeding in kidnapping Angel. He is voiced by Paul St. Peter.

Name: Shrink
Short Description: A small purple experiment with a white lower jaw and chest, three wobbly legs, two stubby little arms and two floppy antennae with two rings on each antenna. Seen in pod form in "Drowsy". Designed to zap a green ray from his antennae to change the size of objects. His picture appears on the wall of Jumba's lab in Leroy & Stitch, along with several other pictures of Jumba and Dr. Hämsterviel's early accomplishments.

Name: Doubledip
Short Description: A purple opossum-like experiment with two light purple stripes on the back of his ears, beady eyes and an orange nose (In Leroy & Stitch, his nose is dark purple). Designed to double-dip food. His one true place is with Mrs. Hasagawa as one of her "cats". He somehow changed in size in Leroy & Stitch.

Name: Howcome
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to annoy Jumba's neighbors by asking repetitive questions like "How come?" and "Why?"

Name: Squawk
Short Description: Designed to act like a parrot and annoy people with a shrill shriek.

Name: Truxx
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to move Jumba's heavy equipment.

Name: Percy
Short Description: Designed to make you walk on all fours.

Name: Gigi
Short Description: A white Shih Tzu-like experiment with a purple bow. Designed to annoy people with her constant barking. She behaves like a typical "good dog": does tricks, licks her owner's face, fetches the morning paper, etc. Because of her appearance and behavior, 007 was adopted by Mertle and wasn't recognized as an experiment until Jumba saw her. Her episode is named "Yapper" after the nickname Lilo gave her, but she is officially "Gigi" on the experiment name list in Leroy & Stitch. Her one true place is with Mertle as her pet. In Leroy and Stitch, it is revealed that she can speak English very well. At the end of the movie, Mertle joins Lilo and Stitch's ohana because Gigi wants to be in it with the rest of Jumba's experiments. She is voiced by Tress MacNeille.

Name: Carmine
Short Description: Designed to smother people in caramel.

Name: Pop
Short Description: Designed to pop balloons at the enemy to surprise and disorient them.

Name: Felix/Oscar
Short Description: A green anteater-like experiment with a small body, mouth, arms and legs, a thin tail with a brushy fuzz at the end, a vacuum-like trunk that can fire lasers, dark eyes, short ears, and three dark-tipped spines. Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to sterilize, disinfect, and clean everything in sight. However, he had a problem with doing these tasks: he threw anything away, assuming it was trash, and tried to "sterilize" anyone, assuming they were germs. 010 was upgraded to try to be less of a neat-freak. Instead, he turned into a dirt-maker (renamed Oscar), so Lilo gave him to Gantu. Gantu sent 010 to Hämsterviel, who didn't like him and sent him back. Gantu set him free, and Lilo and Stitch found him. Later, after he was upgraded, they sent him back to Gantu, who sent him back to Hämsterviel, who sent him back to Gantu when Woops almost broke his cover. Felix/Oscar was rescued later in "Snafu." The only thing that 010 can say with both of his upgrades is dirty, but with Felix he says it disgustedly, while with Oscar he says it happily. Both of 010's names are a reference to the main characters of The Odd Couple. He is voiced by Tress MacNeille.

Name: Inkstain
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to spill ink on everything.

Name: Antitherm
Short Description: Designed to keep Jumba's lab insulated and make for Jumba a sunny day.

Name: Furry
Short Description: Designed to make people grow more hair.

Name: Kernel
Short Description: A tan gourd-shaped experiment with a large opening at the top of his head. Designed to pop popcorn. His one true place is in a movie theater. He was mentioned in "Angel" when Jumba falsely said, "624 is harmless early experiment. Designed to...pop popcorn for Jumba's movie night."

Name: Ruggles
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to be a rug that trips you as you walk over him.

Name: Malt
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to make frozen treats for Jumba.

Name: Lidds
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to take lids off containers.

Name: Puck
Short Description: Designed to be a hockey puck that never misses the goal, and never goes in the opposing team's goal.

Name: Clumsy
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Pod says 19 instead of 019. Designed to drop things.

Name: Slick
Short Description: A fast-talking, pink experiment with a resemblance to Jumba and Cannonball (520), but with a smaller face and two ebony-black eyes who wears a straw boater hat and bowtie, carries a cane, and acts as a salesperson who never turns down a customer. Designed to be able to sell anything to anyone. Lilo used him to get ahead in the chocolate bar selling contest/fundraiser, but Mertle took him. When Lilo took him back, Mertle took him back again. Lilo tried to take him back once more, but found out Mertle sold him to Reuben. Slick was rescued, but Lilo had to give up the contest by giving her last chocolate bar to Gantu as a swap for Slick. His one true place is at a fundraiser, following which he began working for charity, not profit. Slick was one of the experiments Lilo turned to for the capture of Ploot, but besides selling her an umbrella that she later used against Ploot, he didn't/couldn't help. He is voiced by Jeff Glen Bennett.

Name: Twang/Flute
Short Description: A yellow rabbit-like experiment with blue fluff in his ears. He is very manipulative and sly. Designed to absorb likeness and popularity to mutate through three forms. The first is described above, the second is similar to the first but has four arms, is larger, and is much more buff. The third is an ugly, snot-green figure with only two arms, and a huge purple nose. He can switch back to his first form after he's been the second. He is extemely intelligent and specializes in the flute.

Name: Hertz Donut
Short Description: A dark-green, seahorse-like experiment with lips shaped like a donut. Designed to shoot donuts out of his mouth that restrain movements.

Name: Cyclo
Short Description: Designed to spin at high speeds making you feel dizzy.

Name: Hamlette
Short Description: A small yellow experiment. Designed to turn objects into ham. She was activated when Mrs. Hasagawa's cats were activated, as indicated by Gantu's experiment computer, but did not physically appear in the episode. She was referred to in Remmy when Pleakley said, "Is that the one that turns everything into ham?"

Name: Topper
Short Description: A small yellow star-shaped creature with a little antenna on his head. Designed to be a beacon to signal the alien attack fleet, but the official Disney website states his purpose is to keep people awake with his bright light. Topper is given to a little girl as a Christmas present, then placed atop the local Christmas tree and emits a light so bright that aliens from other galaxies can see him from Earth. His number is a reference to Christmas Day (December 25). He is voiced by Tress MacNeille.

Name: Pawn
Short Description: Designed to grab hot plates and other dangerous/fragile materials for Jumba, and make you obsessed with chess, but Jumba accidentally added shrimp DNA into the mix so the only way you could become obsesed is if you were playing near water.

Name: Plushy
Short Description: Designed to turn you into a toy.

Name: Lori
Short Description: Designed to make you jump up and down constantly.

Name: Checkers
Short Description: A yellow centipede-like experiment that sits curled up like a crown on people's heads. Designed to make his wearer a king or queen by hypnotizing those around them, with the exception of other experiments. The victims retain their normal personality while under its control, and the effect immediately wears off once Checkers is removed. Lilo first donned him, but her so-called good intentions got many people arrested by Mertle for being "troublemakers" when they accidentally disobeyed Lilo's rules. When Lilo decided to step down, Gantu took Checkers and was in power until Stitch gathered several experiments to help overthrow him.

Name: Vialet
Short Description: A small purple Gotchu (031)-like experiment with two pincers instead of four and a dragon-like tail. Seen in pod form in "Drowsy". Designed to turn everything a vulgar shade of purple.

Name: Gotchu
Short Description: An orange lobster-like experiment. Designed to run around and pinches things with his four pincers. His one true place is with Mrs. Hasagawa as one of her "cats."

Name: Fibber
Short Description: A small orange experiment with small body, arms and legs, a large head with dark orange mark on the forehead, little antennae, a little mouth, a round nose, black eyes and four ears. Designed to detect lies. When a lie is told, he beeps loudly and the pattern on his forehead lights up. The bigger the lie, the louder he beeps, and the brighter the pattern lights up. Fibber was captured by Gantu, but rescued by Lilo and Stitch in "Snafu." He was also part of Pleakley's E.A.R.W.A.X. group in "Spike." Which was a blooper in the episode since he was captured by Gantu at the time. He is voiced by Jeff Bennett.

Name: Hammerface
Short Description: A blue dinosaur-like experiment with short forearms and a thick tail and legs. Designed to drive in nails around Jumba's house with his hammer-shaped head/face, but at times he will pound living things. He was used by Gantu to defeat Stitch in "Dupe" and rescued by Lilo's rescue team in "Snafu." 033 was called "Hammerhead" by Pleakley in "The Asteroid". In Stitch! The Movie, his number is 124. Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie.

Name: Splort
Short Description: Designed to ruin friendships.

Name: Philip
Short Description: Designed to be a bouncer for Jumba's lab but failed because he wouldn't let anyone in, not even Jumba.

Name: Poki
Short Description: A small yellow and brown opossum-like experiment with a spiked tail. Designed to poke holes in liquid containers. He was seen in "Shoe," where he helped turn Jumba's ship into a hotel by putting up an umbrella over an outdoor table and holding a palette for Lilo to paint an arrow sign titled "Jumba & Pleakley's Bed & Not Breakfast."

Name: Snipper
Short Description: Designed to give Jumba's luxurious hair a trim.

Name: Plats
Short Description: Designed to plait Jumba's hair.

Name: Atlas
Short Description: Designed to be a globe for over 400 different planets.

Name: Backhoe
Short Description: A gray mole-like experiment with large black claws. Designed to scrape up vegetation, and is also an efficient digger. He was first seen in "Shoe," where he dug the pool for "Jumba & Pleakley's Bed & Not Breakfast," and was part of the "rebellion" in "Checkers."

Name: Kitsch
Short Description: Designed to do Jumba's washing up.

Name: Itch
Short Description: Designed to make you extremely itchy.

Name: Cubesteak
Short Description: Designed to make food and meat square.

Name: Forehead
Short Description: A pink, four-headed mustached experiment with four arms and four red bowties on his necks that speaks English. Designed to sing barbershop music off-key, agonizing anyone who hears it. His one true place is with Mrs. Hasagawa as one of her "cats."

Name: Melvin
Short Description: Designed to give people "Melvin's" (a type of wedgie).

Name: Wedgie
Short Description: Designed to give people wedgies.

Name: Lorider
Short Description: A blue platypus-like experiment with an accordion body. Designed to pull down people's pants, therefore causing public humiliation.

Name: Echo
Short Description: Designed to "echo" everything you say using his big mouth on his forehead.

Name: Picker
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to pick fruit from Jumba's neighbor's tree. He is in some Disney Adventure comics (the ones were Jumba is fixing Stitch).

Name: Dunk
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to dunk people in any body of water. He is in some Disney Adventure comics (the ones were Jumba is fixing Stitch).

Name: Hocker
Short Description: A green experiment with a huge blue nose and a yellow spot around his eyes and a yellow stripe on his ears and tail (In his episode the spots and stripes were originally red.). Designed to spit acidic saliva that can burn through wood in about three seconds. His one true place is with Mrs. Hasagawa as one of her "cats."

Name: Coco
Short Description: A chocolate-colored pink-haired lizard/Stitch-like experiment. Designed to turn things into chocolate (from a Disney Adventures magazine). She was given to Lilo by Stitch for her birthday.

Name: Whine
Short Description: Designed to make you whine and complain about everything.

Name: Fudgy
Short Description: An experiment made of chocolate that looks like a blob. Designed to drown people in his sticky sweetness. When he was activated, he was called 119, and he was mistaken for experiment 611. The mistake with his number was due to Jumba's untidy database, although Jumba later corrected this mistake. Was rescued in "Snafu."

Name: Snarfhonk
Short Description: Designed to make a horrible honking noise and make you speak in a series of random noises like "beep ping ping boing".

Name: Nibbiolo
Short Description: Designed to nibble on the corners of anything. He is in some Disney Adventure comics (the ones were Jumba is fixing Stitch).

Name: Tenderizer
Short Description: Designed to tenderize heat up Jumba's meat.

Name: Shortsheet
Short Description: Designed to short-sheet beds.

Name: Tornette
Short Description: Designed to tear paper in half.

Name: Plink
Short Description: Designed to make the color you see change from color to black and white, but failed because his effects made you see in pink.

Name: Anachronator
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to make Jumba's technology better by bringing technology from the future. He is in some Disney Adventure comics (the ones were Jumba is fixing Stitch).

Name: Frenchfry
Short Description: A small gray and white mustached experiment with four arms with three fingers on each hand, black eyes, a round nose, a little mouth, short ears, a chef's hat, and a spatula for a tail. Designed to use his lightning speed, which allows him to instantly prepare food or whip up a mini-tornado in battle. He is also the only experiment in the series that speaks French. Designed to be Jumba's personal chef, but instead made unhealthy food that quickly made people fat and overweight, then ate the fattened victims. However, he stopped when he learned that healthy food could be just as delicious. His one true place is running a healthy French fry hut.

Name: Pufferizer
Short Description: Designed to make people puff up like a balloon.

Name: Nappifier
Short Description: Designed to make you take a nap, (temporary).

Name: Britfood
Short Description: Designed to be a better version of Frenchfry (062) but she only serves seafood or shrimp other than junk food.

Name: Glam
Short Description: Designed to make Jumba look super snazzy.

Name: Shady
Short Description: Designed to make shades.

Name: Tom
Short Description: Designed to improve Jumba's TV reception.

Name: H. T.
Short Description: Designed to be a hot tub for Jumba.

Name: Flopjack
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to make flapjacks for Jumba, but does not work.

Name: Penny
Short Description: Designed to drop pennies off high areas.

Name: Stickystuck
Short Description: Designed to put glue on chairs and glue things together with sticky saliva.

Name: Cornerpiece
Short Description: Designed to be a corner piece for a corner. He is in some Disney Adventure comics (the ones were Jumba is fixing Stitch).

Name: Welco
Short Description: A pink balloon-dog-experiment with a heart-shaped tail. She has humanoid eyes and big lips. Designed to spit temporary solid bubbles.

Name: WooWoo
Short Description: Designed to make you over-confident.

Name: Bath Matt
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to be a bathmat.

Name: Zawp
Short Description: A fat purple Nosy (199)-like experiment with black nails, a dark blue stripe around his torso between his chest and stomach, a dark blue circle on the top of his head, dark blue-striped ears, a larger belly and a slightly smaller, gold nose. Designed to irritate people with his constant snoring. His one true place is with Mrs. Hasagawa as one of her "cats." Pod says 277 instead of 077.

Name: Snozzle
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Pod says 78 instead of 078. Designed to sneeze fake money.

Name: Fogger
Short Description: Designed to fog up windows.

Name: Dan
Short Description: Designed to entertain Jumba by playing the violin.

Name: Backscratcher
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to scratch part of Jumba's back he can't reach.

Name: Plunge
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to unclog Jumba's toilet, after he had an... incident. Pod says 82 instead of 082.

Name: Grimple
Short Description: Designed to be a bug catcher in order to make the natural order become chaos.

Name: Subwoof
Short Description: Designed to woof if he sees a bus.

Name: Screw-up
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to be nothing Jumba screwed up for. All he does is lay down and do nothing. He is in some Disney Adventure comics (the ones where Jumba is fixing Stitch).

Name: Clink
Short Description: A big green mouthless crab-like experiment with four legs, two large claws and a window on its chest. Able to capture and confine any other experiment inside the holding tank in his stomach by splitting in half, surrounding whatever he wants to catch, and joining together again. When Clink splits in two, he works with himself, yet he seems to have a separate mind for each half. 20 years in an alternate future, Lilo, Stitch, and Skip encountered Clink in the possession of Hämsterviel, who ruled Earth and the rest of the universe.

Name: Puddles
Short Description: Designed to cry so much that she makes puddles.

Name: Decrisper
Short Description: Designed to make Jumba's burnt food less crispy by putting it in his pouch in his belly.

Name: Skip
Short Description: A purple hourglass-shaped experiment with small eyes. Designed to skip time by 10 minutes, because Jumba was too impatient to wait for his microwave to reheat his leftovers. However, there was an error in his program: he skips time by ten years. Fortunately, he has a reset button. Lilo used him to jump ahead 10 years and become a teenager, then 20 years later to become a full-fledged adult. However, since Lilo and Stitch were gone for 20 years, no one was there to catch experiments except Gantu. So 20 years later, Hämsterviel ruled Earth.

Name: Fetchit
Short Description: This experiment was activated when Mrs. Hasagawa's cats were. Designed to fetch the morning paper for Jumba.

Name: Nutsy
Short Description: Designed to steal things and replace them with walnuts.

Name: Gutman
Short Description: Designed to have super strength.

Name: Unkind
Short Description: Designed to be unkind to everyone for no reason whatsoever.

Name: Louis B.
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to make and play horror movies to scare away nosy neighbors. Pod says 94 instead of 094.

Name: Coaster
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to be a roller coaster without tracks.

Name: Cable Dude
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to fix a TV's cable by plugging himself into the back of the TV.

Name: Dogalarm
Short Description: Seen in pod form in "Drowsy". Designed to be a living dog whistle.

Name: Cooper
Short Description: Designed to make people cooperate with each other.

Name: Spot
Short Description: A spotlight experiment that was supposed to be in "Spike" but was removed, and was supposed to appear later. Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to shine a spotlight on people.

Name: Trickster
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to pull tricks on people.

Name: Trike
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie Designed to tickle people who ride him.

Name: Stopgo
Short Description: A yellow experiment with a long, narrow neck like a traffic pole, and a traffic light-shaped head with a green and red light (most likely his eyes, oriented vertically) on each side of his head. Designed to cause traffic jams. Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie and 'Drowsy' and seen activated in Leroy & Stitch. When he first appeared, he was called 239 due to Jumba's untidy database, but this mistake was corrected. His one true place is as a traffic light.

Name: Stamen
Short Description: A tan-gray, upside-down ice cream-shaped, mouse-like experiment with an oval body, little arms and legs, big ears, a big mouth, no tail, black eyes, a round blue nose and rabbit-like ears. Designed to prevent pollination of flowers by attracting alien "bees" to himself. He was first seen being rescued in "Snafu."

Name: Lapse
Short Description: Designed to destroy enemy weapons and electronics such as computers and blasters with the horn on his nose.

Name: Fold
Short Description: Designed to fold paper until its permanently unreadable.

Name: Spindle
Short Description: Designed to steal and eat threads.

Name: Mutilate
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to make people think the right thing is wrong and the wrong things is right. In one scene his pod was yellow, but in another it was purple.

Name: Nudge
Short Description: Designed to nudge you.

Name: Sounder
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to produced high frequency whistle sound from his ears to shatter any type of glass.

Name: Squeak
Short Description: A small red mouse-like experiment, vaguely resembling animator Friz Freleng's character Sniffles from the Warner Brothers Merrie Melodies series. Designed to annoy entire planets with his never-ending talking. He is voiced by Rob Paulsen.

Name: Mulch
Short Description: A red experiment that resembles a push-mower. Designed to tear up the ground beneath his feet. His one true place is with Mrs. Hasagawa as one of her "cats."

Name: Toons
Short Description: A yellow platypus-like experiment with an orange mane and a rectangular vacuum-like mouth. Designed to transform into the subject of any drawing inserted into his mouth, as well as has the ability to make images on paper come to life in 3D.

Name: Shoe
Short Description: A green and white sloth-like experiment with a wiry body and a round face with black eyes, a small dark purple round nose, a wide mouth and two long, curved horns. Able to control luck. When his horns are up, they cause good luck. When down, they cause bad luck. He can be switched from bad luck to good luck by flipping his horseshoe. His one true place is at a miniature golf course, where he makes people score holes-in-one.

Name: Skyooz
Short Description: Designed to destroy the ozone layer.

Name: Sellby
Short Description: Designed to sell you things at high prices.

Name: Switch
Short Description: Designed to put switches in the opposite directions (ex. If something is “Off” he’ll turn it “On”.) When he points his tails at two different people he has the power to switch the two.

Name: Tock
Short Description: Designed to change the times on all clocks.

Name: Fink
Short Description: Designed to betray you.

Name: Inverto
Short Description: He was misunderstood as Experiment 611. He was reported by Dr. Jacques Von Hämsterviel as a chocolate experiment who drowns people into his sweetness, which actually is Experiment 054 (Fudgy). Designed to make people and objects turn inside out. He is in some Disney Adventure comics (the ones were Jumba is fixing Stitch).

Name: Snafu
Short Description: A small dark green-teal octopus-like experiment with a roughly reptilian face with wide mouth, small white eyes with black pupils, a small round body, little arms and legs with small hands and feet, little tail, black markings on his back, and six tentacles on his large dome head; three on each end of his head. Designed to foil enemy plans by any possible means. He will ruin any plans to catch him. The only way to catch him is by accident. Named for the acronym SNAFU.

Name: Sappy
Short Description: Designed to make people more and more sappy.

Name: Dorkifier
Short Description: A pink calf-like experiment with two horns. Designed to zap a pink ray from his horns that changes anyone's appearance into something ridiculous. Also, the new dorky clothes cannot be taken off the victim, until his horns are turned like Shoe.

Name: Carmen
Short Description: A pink, blue-eyed, antennaless, Angel (624)-like experiment, wearing a headdress of fruits and holding a maraca in each of her four hands. Designed to make people dance until they drop, after her namesake Carmen Miranda.

Name: Rhymer
Short Description: Hammerface was mistakenly labeled 124 in Stitch! The Movie due to Jumba's untidy Database. Designed to make and sing rock music.

Name: Gibberish
Short Description: Designed to reflect soundwaves and once reflected it will come back to you as gibberish.

Name: Stank
Short Description: A black skunk-like experiment with purple eyes. Designed to launch out spheres of repulsive odor from underneath her fur.

Name: Dembums
Short Description: Designed to annoy you by playing his demon music.

Name: Bugby
Short Description: A small green mosquito-like experiment with four eyes. Designed to turn whole civilizations into harmless little insects. Anyone turned into an insect can understand all other insects and arachnids. The only way to reverse the effect is with a machine built by Jumba. 128 was later reprogrammed to only turn inanimate objects into insects. His one true place is helping farmers by turning rocks into swarms of aphid-eating ladybugs.

Name: Crutch
Short Description: Designed to break bones.

Name: Bonez
Short Description: Designed to take your bones so you become a squishy blob.

Name: Poik
Short Description: Designed to slap you three times. After she did it, she will laugh until she slaps another person. Also her laugh is loud and sounds like "poikpoikpoikpoik"

Name: Spoony
Short Description: Designed to steal spoons at lunch time.

Name: PJ
Short Description: An orange and tan koala-like experiment with a white face, a wide mouth, red nose, black eyes, yellow-tipped antennae that mix with thin rabbit-like ears, and a functioning blow-horn for a tail (reminiscent of Harpo Marx's trademark horn) which he squeaks instead of speaking. He wears joke eyeglasses with a fake nose and mustache resembling those of Groucho Marx. Designed to play practical jokes on people, hence his name P(ractical) J(oker). His one true place is as an opening act for Moses's Hula gig. In the group photo taken at the end of Leroy & Stitch and the Disney.com Lilo and Stitch experiment gallery, PJ is not wearing his glasses. It is possible that the glasses were broken during battle.

Name: Shredder
Short Description: A green experiment with sharp steel teeth, large ears and a blue nose. Designed to shred important documents. His one true place is with Mrs. Hasagawa as one of her "cats."

Name: Remote
Short Description: Designed to enter anybody's house and eat their remotes. He can serve as a universal remote to cause havoc by shutting down TVs.

Name: Gloomy
Short Description: Designed to make you feel sad and depressed.

Name: Flip
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to flip things over.

Name: Dropsy
Short Description: Designed to make you drop things.

Name: I Know You Are But What Am I
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to mimic what people say.

Name: Changeling
Short Description: What Jumba wanted from 140 was an evil experiment that would tear apart complicated wiring and computer systems. What he got was a small cute pink pig-like experiment with no desire to destroy anything. However at night 140 transforms into a purple, four-legged added demon that proceeded to carry out his primary function. In the morning he goes back to a little pink pig experiment.

Name: Burr
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to make it really cold.

Name: Blondie
Short Description: Designed to dye your hair blond.

Name: Clog
Short Description: Mentioned in "Skip" when Reuben said, "The one whose hair is always clogging the sink." Designed to clog up drains with his hair, as Reuben implied.

Name: Samolean
Short Description: Designed to dig for gold in the mines.

Name: Bragg
Short Description: Designed to make you extremely conceded and braggy.

Name: Flashbomb
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch special feature the experiment profile. Designed to make you blind with his constant flashes.
Episode: Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch

Name: Newton
Short Description: Designed to have control over gravity.

Name: Weasel
Short Description: A brown weasel-like experiment. Seen in pod form in "Houdini". Designed to climb up planetary leader's pant legs during public appearances.

Name: Bonnie
Short Description: A light green koala-like experiment smaller than Stitch with a yellow stomach, a slim body, small antennae, big dark blue eyes, a big head, a wide mouth with two fangs sticking out, a round nose, rabbit-like ears, two dark green marks on the back of her head, dark green, arrow-like patches on arms and legs, and a yellow V-shaped stripe on her forehead, found with 150. Named after bank robber Bonnie Parker. Designed to steal things without the victim's knowledge, as well as her special weapons are pistol and plasma gun. 149 and 150 are captured and end up in prison as convicts, but they are paroled as part of the rescue party in "Snafu." Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. She is voiced by Tress MacNeille.
Episode: 135,226,201, Leroy and Stitch, Stitch! The Movie

Name: Clyde
Short Description: A light brown bear-like experiment with a roundly built body, a round face with a wide mouth, a small black nose, little pointed ears, little stubby antennae, black eyes, and a lantern chin, with a sort of Swiss army knife-like gun for a right hand on a robotic arm from the elbow down, found with 149. Named after bank robber Clyde Barrow. Designed to steal things without the victim's knowledge. 149 and 150 are captured and end up in prison as convicts, but they are paroled as part of the rescue party in "Snafu. Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. He is voiced by Rocky McMurray.

Name: Babyfier
Short Description: A small pink oddly sheep-like experiment with a big head, purple insect-like wings, a yellow pacifier in her mouth and a baby rattle-shaped tail. Designed to disable planets by turning adults into babies with a pink powder shaken from her tail. The antidote is a mix of two teaspoons of applesauce, one cup of milk, three bananas, and 100% kona coffee. Her one true place is at the dog pound making older dogs young again, thus making them more appealing to potential adopters.

Name: Mama Frita
Short Description: Designed to give you leftover food.

Name: XYZ
Short Description: Designed to unzip people's pants while they are being worn.

Name: Frapp
Short Description: Designed to turn hot things cold.

Name: Burger
Short Description: Designed to make different kinds of burgers.

Name: Shopahol
Short Description: Designed to make any person addicted to shopping.

Name: Hotl
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch special feature the experiment profile. Designed to give off a pleasant warmth that gradually increases.
Episode: Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch

Name: Finder
Short Description: A red aardvark/shrew-like experiment with little arms and legs, no tail, a long snout, black eyes, and large rabbit-like ears. Designed to find anything and honk when he finds it, even spinning his ears like helicopter blades if necessary in order to find what he has been asked to locate. His one true place is operating a "Lost and Found" service on the beach. He was in the rescue party for "Snafu." Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie.

Name: Nacho
Short Description: Designed to steal cheese.

Name: Rabbit
Short Description: Designed to eat all the vegetables in a local area so that Jumba wouldn't have to.

Name: Grumbelly
Short Description: Designed to make you look very angry if you eat his cherry.

Name: Tub
Short Description: Designed to be a hot tub but hates water.

Name: Dumbell
Short Description: Designed to to annoy you by repeatedly ringing his bell.

Name: Lesdyxia
Short Description: This experiment's name is a hidden joke: Dyslexia read by a dyslexic person. Designed to give you dyslexia.

Name: Sandy
Short Description: Designed to create sandstorms.

Name: Peppah
Short Description: Designed to put pepper on 155's burger. If you ask him what did you put there? He only says "peppah!"

Name: Frizzy
Short Description: Designed to freeze time.

Name: Redped
Short Description: Designed to make everything red, and play loud music.

Name: Rolo
Short Description: Designed to be a living ball that rolls anywhere nonstop.

Name: Daze
Short Description: Designed to cause blizzards.

Name: Rich
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to give you counterfeit money. He works with 172 and 173. When Jumba was making 171 the embryo split into 3 so he only has 2 of the 6 powers he was supposed to intelligence and strength. He is good, but he is weak-willed and is usually bullied into being evil by 172.

Name: Ditch
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to dig ditches in the most inconvenient places. He works with 171 and 173. When Jumba was making 171 the embryo split into 3 so he only has 2 of the 6 powers he was supposed to speed and sharp claws.

Name: Mitch
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to be the leader. She works with 171 and 172. When Jumba was making 171 the embryo split into 3 so she only has 2 of the 6 powers she was supposed to flight and a lethal sting. She is neutral but tens to choose evil because of her brother 172.

Name: Nopost
Short Description: Designed to steal mail.

Name: Kite
Short Description: Designed to fly like a kite with you on his back and drop you in jail.

Name: Allsox
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to do the opposite of what Nosox (204) does. Instead of stealing socks, he helps people to find their missing socks.

Name: Clip
Short Description: A small yellow hairball-like experiment with a pink bow, dark blue eyes, and long scissor-like claws. Designed to eat Uburnium (an efficient, cheap, and abundant fuel used in outer space) in order to create a fuel crisis. However, in Jumba's native language, the word "Uburnium" closely resembles the word for "hair", so she eats hair instead of Uburnium (in fact, Jumba had more before her creation). As 177 eats more hair, she grows larger and larger, to where she can only be tamed by shampoo and hair conditioning products. Her one true place is cutting hair at the beauty salon.

Name: Barkleigh
Short Description: Designed to bark loudly through his megaphone mouth when he hears a noise.

Name: Bumper
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to bump things over.

Name: Boggle
Short Description: Designed to confuse or mystify experienced physicists alike.

Name: Roberts
Short Description: Designed to crank up the TV to its maximum volume.

Name: Ollie
Short Description: Designed to be a living radio and annoy people by playing a music when he sees a person sleeping.

Name: Detour
Short Description: Designed to give you good directions when you aren't lost.

Name: NPH
Short Description: Designed to give you a “Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus”.

Name: Splutter
Short Description: Designed to have various gas-emitting stud-like orifices surrounding its body.

Name: Laakso
Short Description: Designed to make things salty and can swim very well.

Name: Cal
Short Description: Designed to perform work such as carrying objects on his back.

Name: Forward
Short Description: Designed to fast forward the show you’re watching until it ends.

Name: Hotcold
Short Description: Designed to switch the hot and cold valves on sink faucets.

Name: Florrie
Short Description: Designed to destroy flower vases.

Name: Roxy
Short Description: Designed to make trash and litter appear everywhere.

Name: Breakup
Short Description: Designed to break up things.

Name: Will
Short Description: Designed to throw water balls.

Name: Trax
Short Description: Designed to be the guard for Jumba’s lab.

Name: Whoooa!
Short Description: Designed to be so much fun you never get any work done.

Name: Escalater
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to used his scales on his back as an escalator.

Name: Pretzel
Short Description: Designed to eat all the chocolate 052 made.

Name: Carat
Short Description: Designed to put lots of rats inside your car.

Name: Nosy
Short Description: A red pig-like experiment with a pink stomach from the chin down, a roundly built body with thick legs, huge arms with three small fingers on each hand, a wide mouth, a very big nose, little black eyes, little rabbit-like ears, black markings on his back and black stripes on the front of his legs. Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to snoop out enemy secrets but ends up finding out mostly useless gossip. Also, Jumba programmed 199 to be an expert escape artist. He was later caught by Gantu, who thought that 199 would tell him all of Lilo and Stitch's files. Instead, he only talked about useless information and revealed secrets about Gantu to 625. Woops (600) "accidentally" broke Nosy's capsule on Gantu's ship, freeing him. He is voiced by Bobcat Goldthwait.
Episode: 128, 224,226, Leroy and Stitch, Stitch! The Movie

Name: Adam
Short Description: Designed to be very simple, and not do much except when seduced by 372.

Name: Geigenstein
Short Description: This experiment was one of the pods in Mrs. Hasagawa's dish that was not activated. Designed to eat books.

Name: Jam
Short Description: A purple bat/lizard-like experiment with four arms, a lion-like tail, large wings on his shoulders and a Stitch-like face. Designed to jam radars with his high-pitched screech. Activated at the end of Stitch! The Movie.

Name: Snipe
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to hunt people.

Name: Nosox
Short Description: A blue experiment shaped like a four-legged washing machine. Designed to make socks disappear. 204 was among the 12 new pods Lilo and Stitch brought home. Nosox was one of the experiments rescued in "Snafu", because Gantu caught him around "Amnesio".

Name: Cheney
Short Description: Seen in pod form in "Skip". Designed to to zap a person then zap a house, planet, etc. and make the person own it.

Name: Maggie
Short Description: Designed to use her different kinds of guard-like disguises to brake into stores and let robbers in.

Name: Barcode
Short Description: Designed to reveal your pin codes by writing on walls.

Name: Hoax
Short Description: Designed to collect atmospheric data.

Name: Smoot
Short Description: Designed to be so cute that anyone who sees him will do whatever he says.

Name: Retro
Short Description: A small orange dinosaur-like experiment with a purple nose, tiny gold-tipped ears, gold markings on his back and spots around his eyes and a thick, short tail and legs. Designed to turn enemy weapons and technology into their most primitive state by wrapping his tongue around the object, rendering the object useless as he lets go. This process also works on people and other items, and it can be reversed by spanking 210's bottom three times while his tongue is wrapped around the de-evolved person or thing. His one true place is making dinosaurs for a prehistoric zoo, by devolving fossils.

Name: Jangle
Short Description: Designed to turn things and humans into monkeys.

Name: 2-Late
Short Description: Designed to make you 2 hours late.

Name: UHF
Short Description: Designed to speak at an Ultra High Frequency.

Name: Pix
Short Description: A blue camera-like experiment with arms with three legs similar to a tripod. Designed to take only bad pictures of people. He takes the pictures with his "nose" and develops the pictures like a Polaroid camera with the pictures coming out of his mouth. His one true place is with Mrs. Hasagawa as one of her "cats."

Name: Crammer
Short Description: Designed to cram everything together.

Name: Key
Short Description: Designed to open any lock with his key-like tail.

Name: Rat
Short Description: Designed to rat.

Name: Target
Short Description: Designed to be a moving target for war games but is too big and not challenging enough.

Name: Missy
Short Description: Designed to plug the holes in air filters crucial to all H-drives but is too small.

Name: Millie
Short Description: A giant green millipede-like experiment with a koala-like face, a wide mouth, a big blue nose, black eyes, Nosy-like ears and ten short tentacle limbs. Seen in pod form in "Drowsy". Designed to plug the holes in air filters crucial to all H-drives.

Name: Sparky
Short Description: A small light yellow Chinese dragon/Monkey/Gecko-like creature with skinny arms, legs, and body, a slightly twisted yet pointed tail, a large head with a wide mouth, a round nose, dark blue eyes and long antennae that can create crippling electric surges. His body can turn into an electrical current, so he can also fly or travel through outlets, power lines, and machines. He was the first experiment that Lilo and Stitch met and rehabilitated, first appearing in Stitch! The Movie. His one true place is powering the old lighthouse that had been abandoned for requiring too much electricity, though he offers Stitch aid. He is voiced by Frank Welker in the series. Sparky also appears as a boss in the PSP game Kingdom Hearts Birth by Sleep, fighting Terra within Gantu's ship.
Episode: Stitch! The Movie, Leroy and Stitch, many episodes

Name: Poxy
Short Description: A tiny pale green-grey single-celled experiment with pink-purple spots and four white grey-tipped antennae. Designed to transmit disease to popular planetary leaders and disable them. The symptoms are purple pimples, smelly feet, a swollen eye, and uncontrollable burping. When he turns to good, he could cure health problems. Ends up with (actually in) Gantu, until he was rescued in "Snafu" and later uses his powers to cure people according to a game in the DVD for Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch. He is voiced by Frank Welker.
Episode: 101, 226, Stitch! The Movie, Leroy and Stitch

Name: Glitch
Short Description: A bright green experiment with a round torso, pudgy arms and legs, a large round head with little mouth, round nose, dark green eyes, a small arrow-shaped mark above his face (In his episode, his marking was originally V-shaped) and two thin antennae that resembles a cross between Morpholomew (316) and Poxy (222). Designed to turn technology against its user by entering machines and making them malfunction, operating like a computer virus. Lilo tricked him into being downloaded into her video game. He was released as of Leroy and Stitch to help fight the Leroy clones. His one true place is Lilo's video game, rendering the games harder.

Name: Tweak
Short Description: Designed to reset important valves and dials to “maximum chaos.”

Name: Mashy
Short Description: A light blue dinosaur-like experiment, with a huge mouth, with tiny horns above each nostril, 2 large ears, and a large body. Designed to crush orbs of precious Uburnium in his mouth, which Clip (177) was originally made to do, due to an error on Jumba's part, Uburnium being close to the word for hair on his planet.

Name: Combo
Short Description: Designed to make your food a combo.

Name: Butter
Short Description: A large tan mammoth-like creature with two tiny little antennae, a big round green nose instead of trunk, green markings on his back, legs at the middle of his torso with external toes, a big hump near his face, and tusks as large as the entire front of his body. Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to batter through even the thickest doors.
Episode: Stitch! The Movie, Leroy and Stitch

Name: Melty
Short Description: A small red dragon-like experiment with small bat-like wings, a reptilian head with thin pointed ears, black eyes and a thin body. Designed to melt enemy fortresses, weapons, and transportation, among other things, with the bright blue blasts from his mouth. His one true place is burning metal at the recycling plant. He is voiced by Tress MacNeille.

Name: Kingpin
Short Description: An unlucky experiment that looks like a yellow bowling pin with rabbit ears. Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed as a target for military war games.

Name: Checkup
Short Description: Designed to launch checkup attacks on unsuspecting people by annoying them with checkups checking heart beat, checking ears, checking for sore throats.

Name: Sprok
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch special feature the experiment profiler. Designed to spit up slime.
Episode: Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch

Name: Poser
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to be a flashlight.

Name: Pitch
Short Description: Designed to catch incoming projectiles and through them back.

Name: Shush
Short Description: A pink weasel-like experiment with large ears and a speaker at the end of her tail. Designed to eavesdrop on private enemy conversations. To stop her from eavesdropping, someone has to pat her on the head. Her one true place is with Cobra Bubbles as a CIA operative.

Name: Docker
Short Description: This experiment was one of the pods in Mrs. Hasagawa's dish that was not activated. Designed to turn houses into boat docks.

Name: Charger
Short Description: Seen in pod form in "Drowsy". Designed to have his body fold up into his head and then launch over high walls by Sproing (249). Then destroy everything inside.

Name: Blip
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to create blip-enhancement field for all ships around him.

Name: Bworp
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch Speed Chase on the Disney Site. Designed to say "bworp" when he dunks you in water.

Name: Clickster
Short Description: This experiment is mentioned in "Drowsy" when Pleakley said, "experiment 239 designed to cause traffic jams" However he does not cause traffic jams, he was mistaken for Stogo, experiment 102. Designed to click with her hands.

Name: Sap
Short Description: Designed to to leave a sticky sap-like residue from his feet when he walks.

Name: Press-5
Short Description: Designed to leave you on hold forever.

Name: Brownout
Short Description: Designed to disable power grids and electrical generators by consuming their energy.

Name: Pane
Short Description: Designed to to write jokes. His partner is 244.

Name: Bore
Short Description: Designed to tell jokes. His partner is 243.

Name: Sournote
Short Description: Designed to sing a single note that is so bad everyone could go deaf just from hearing it.

Name: Creamer
Short Description: Designed to put cream on sandwiches.

Name: Poggers
Short Description: Designed to put Pogs in the chat

Name: Belle
Short Description: A small blue experiment with a forkpitch-shaped head with an upside-down arrow-shaped mark on her forehead, a small body, thin arms and a small lion-like tail and that looks like a cross between Holio and Heat. Designed to scare people with a loud high-pitched shriek. Her one true place is Nani's alarm clock. She is voiced by Tara Stong.

Name: Sproing
Short Description: A dark blue and white roughly koala-like experiment with a spring-like body, a wide mouth, round nose, dark eyes, two little ears and little antennae. Seen in pod form in "Drowsy". Designed to launch boulders. Her one true place is helping people reach high places.

Name: Lacrosse
Short Description: Designed to be an expert at lacrosse.

Name: Link
Short Description: A small yellow Grundo-like experiment with red eyes and long antennae that shoot a sticky substance that will only dissolve in mud. Designed to bind together incompatible individuals, usually by the hand or wrist. His one true place is helping arguing couples bungee jump.

Name: Crete
Short Description: Designed to encase people and objects in stone.

Name: Uncrete
Short Description: Designed to undo the ability of 252.

Name: Mr. Stenchy
Short Description: An irresistibly cute pink experiment with a big head with big blue eyes, puffy antennae and a small hair and a small body. Designed to trick his enemies into taking him into their homes. Once there, Mr. Stenchy lets out a noxious odor, released 42 hours after activation. Mr. Stenchy's one true place on Pleakley's home planet, where his stench is considered a rare and valuable perfume. Somehow he ended up back on Earth in Leroy & Stitch, stench-free, suggesting he can either control the smell or it wears off after a while. He is voiced by Frank Welker.

Name: Mrs. Sickly
Short Description: Mrs. Sickly is a light Green Mr. Stenchy (254)-like experiment with golden hair, puffier antennae and smaller hair. Designed to make you sick with her obnoxious fumes. Mrs. Sickly’s one true place is with Mr. Stenchy as his wife, where her fumes are considered a rare and valuable perfume.

Name: Addy
Short Description: Designed to make your nose extremely runny.

Name: Rattat
Short Description: Designed to turn you into a dog.

Name: Sample
Short Description: A bright orange koala-like experiment with a wide mouth, a big round nose which functions as a microphone, black pupil-less eyes, and big round ears resembling speakers. Designed to annoy enemies by looping random sounds with his mouth or his ears and can also climb walls. His one true place is providing backbeats for an originally rhythm-less musical group. He was in the rescue mission for "Snafu."

Name: Rash
Short Description: Designed to give you a perfect rash if you touch him.

Name: GPS
Short Description: Designed to be Jumba’s personal Global Positioning Satellite.

Name: B. V. Beaverton
Short Description: Designed to cut down trees with its chainsaw-like tail.

Name: Ace
Short Description: A bright red, roughly koala/dragon/superhero-like experiment with a muscular body, yellow chest and stomach, white gloves-style front paws, a wide mouth, a blue nose, dark eyes, pointed ears and small antennae as well as four arms, super strength, warm ice-melting breath, and dazzling teeth. He has one fatal error: he has no evil function and is a failed experiment that is pure good. To top it off, he is the only experiment programmed not to cause trouble or mayhem unlike his other "cousins" initially were. When Jumba was about to have his membership revoked from E.G.O. (Evil Genius Organization), Lilo and Stitch tried to trick the head of E.G.O. into thinking that Jumba was still evil. The plan worked until a screen of Ace rescuing a cat from a house on fire was seen. His one true place is balancing out Jumba's evil and acting as a local do-gooder. His experiment number - 262- is the "opposite" of 626 - Stitch's number; Ace is good, and Stitch had been evil. He is also polar opposites with 627. He is voiced by Jeff Bennett.

Name: SFS
Short Description: Designed to have "smart file system".

Name: Poach
Short Description: Designed to hunt rare animals.

Name: Wip
Short Description: Designed to whip you hard with her lasso-like snake tail.

Name: 10x
Short Description: Designed to multiply himself by 10.

Name: Wishy-Washy
Short Description: A lavender-bluish teddy bear-like experiment with fairy-like wings that enable him to fly. He also has a "wand" on his head that lights up every time a wish is granted, and is also good for throwing an unsuspecting opponent, like Stitch. Designed to be a wish giver that grants any wish he hears, but the wishes are granted literally and may not turn out quite as expected. In addition to rejecting wishes for more wishes, he also has a wish limit, indicated by a small meter on his stomach which starts out completely red. As wishes are granted, the meter slowly goes down. When white, all the wishes are gone, and 267 is deemed useless.

Name: Celsenheit
Short Description: Designed to mess-up thermometers.

Name: Gyrotta
Short Description: Designed to follow her enemy to its secret hiding place.

Name: Gillmore
Short Description: Designed to designed to be the back-up of 269 but has a glitch, instead being back-up he is now in love with 269

Name: Noso
Short Description: Designed to say "so"? After you say "no".

Name: Wormhole
Short Description: A purple and cyan caterpillar-like experiment with black eyes, two dark purple-tipped antennae, four dark purple-tipped legs and blue mouth inside. Designed to create a wormhole to parallel universes, by folding himself together and then spinning.

Name: Boxboom
Short Description: Designed to be a pro boxer and box you all over the place, making you sore and have broken bones.

Name: Alexander
Short Description: Designed to make lots of long distance telephone calls. He makes calls on your phone to run up the cost on your phone bill. One of the 12 new pods found by Lilo & Stitch. His name is obviously taken from Alexander Graham Bell, the inventor of the telephone.

Name: Tickle-Tummy
Short Description: A round, pink experiment with rabbit-like ears, no legs, a clownish face, two hands with long fingers and a large patterned torso, which she uses to jump really high. Designed to tickle people. She was caught by Gantu and rescued in "Snafu".

Name: Remmy
Short Description: A blue experiment with a huge head that resembles a Pac-Man ghost. Designed to enter a sleeping person's head and turn dreams into nightmares. If the person wakes up while he is still inside, 276 will remain there permanently to turn all future dreams into nightmares. Also, 276 was designed to attack at peak of the subconscious enjoyment. His one true place is making virtual reality games. His name is in reference to the REM stage of sleep, in which dreams occur. He is voiced by Rob Paulsen.

Name: Snooty
Short Description: A light purple bat-like experiment with a furless, triangle-like body, little legs, two fingers and a thumb on each of his wings, hardly any neck, fanged wide mouth, two little nostrils, pointed ears and black eyes. Designed to find and enrich "Snootonium," a rare element that becomes extremely dangerous once enriched. Snootonium has a similar chemical makeup as that of mucus on Earth. To help clear her sinuses, Lilo's friend Victoria decides to keep Snooty as a pet, as his one true place.

Name: Pasthole
Short Description: Designed to be a living black hole that sucks you up and takes you to the past.

Name: Futurehole
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch special feature the experiment profiler. Designed to be a living black hole that sucks you up and takes you to the future.
Episode: Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch

Name: Benedict Arnold
Short Description: Designed to find out the enemy’s plans for you, but has a glitch and tells the enemy your plan.

Name: Ray
Short Description: Designed to zap you with his ray.

Name: Click
Short Description: Designed to click a lot.

Name: Quarklifter
Short Description: Designed to be as strong as 626.

Name: Pixel
Short Description: Designed to steal the pictures 214 takes.

Name: Lax
Short Description: A purple parrot-like experiment with a small antenna, a beak and tail feathers. Designed to fire a green ray from his antenna that will cause anything it hits to stop working, and can also climb walls. A person hit with 285's ray will relax, and even a machine hit with the ray will shut down. The ray can be blocked or bounced off reflective surfaces. However, the ray wears off in time. His one true place is at the airport, making grouchy business people enjoy their vacation.

Name: Gellasifier
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch special feature the experiment profiler. Designed to be a plant eater.
Episode: Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch

Name: Burl
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. Designed to to undo the work of 141.

Name: Boomer
Short Description: A small white and brown experiment with a curved head and lightweight body. Designed to be a living boomerang. His one true place is with Mrs. Hasagawa as one of her "cats."

Name: Stringulator
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch special feature the experiment profiler. Designed to make bad sounds using his guitar-like body.
Episode: Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch

Name: U-port
Short Description: Designed to lie about delays. For example. If there are no delays 290 will say there are delays. And if there are delays 290 will say that there are no delays.

Name: Catalyst
Short Description: Designed to turn things into cats.

Name: Whatsamattafoyou
Short Description: Designed to make you talk like a gangster.

Name: Vacuum
Short Description: Designed to clean floors and suck crumbs.

Name: Poppapoppup
Short Description: Designed to keep you up all night by playing drums.

Name: Spineless
Short Description: Designed to make you lose your spine.

Name: Crash
Short Description: Seen in pod form in Stitch Speed Chase on the Disney Site. Designed to cause car crashes, enter unattended vehicles, steal them and take them for joyrides ending in accidents.

Name: Shortstuff
Short Description: A red-orange crab-like experiment with four claws, four legs, dark blue eyes and two antennae on his head, able to swivel at the waist more than 360°. Designed to destroy machinery by going inside and cutting the mechanism and electrical wiring. His size was greatly increased by accident, thanks to Jumba's growth ray. His one true place is as an amusement park ride. He is voiced by Nancy Cartwright.

Name: Cat
Short Description: Designed to be a pet.

Name: Dimensionator
Short Description: Designed to warp entire cities into different dimensions.

Name: Spooky
Short Description: A green blob-like experiment with olive green eyes, a wide mouth and three round, short, stubby spikes on his back, greatly resembling the other Disney (and Halloween based) character Oogie Boogie. Designed to scare people by morphing/shapeshifting into their worst horrifying fears. Appears during Halloween. His one true place is as a greeter for trick-or-treaters during Halloween, and at an old house believed to be haunted during the rest of the year.

Name: Progno
Short Description: Designed to make things fail.

Name: Noidster
Short Description: Designed to produce a soothing glow and make everything go quiet.

Name: Amnesio
Short Description: A small blue beetle-like creature with a round body, two thick arms, two thick legs, a purple mark on his stomach, two large wings on his back, a round face with large black eyes, a little mouth, and two antennae. Designed to erase people's memory by zapping a red laser vision in their eyes. Seen in pod form in Stitch! The Movie. The password "ohana" must be spoken to reverse its effects. (How Jumba knew this word, which is Hawaiian, and why he chose that particular word before he came to Earth are unknown.) 303 was given to Dr. Hämsterviel, who promptly lost his memory. He was rescued in "Snafu." He is voiced by Tress MacNeille.
Episode: 118, 226, Leroy and Stitch, Stitch! The Movie

Name: Drag
Short Description: Designed to split a person in two opposing directions.

Name: Spunky
Short Description: Designed to be 066's assistant.
